message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a novel multi-layer RNN model for NLP tasks, specifically sentence classification. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the vanishing-gradient and overfitting problems commonly found in deep architectures, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of deep neural networks and their abilities in exploring a larger hypothesis space could also place this paper in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed model on benchmark datasets of sentence classification, which could also make it relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
